message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.NI. 

The paper deals with coding theory and graph theory, which are both subfields of information theory (cs.IT). The concept of stopping redundancy is related to error-correcting codes, which falls under the category of computational complexity (cs.CC). The paper also uses probabilistic methods and recurrent inequalities, which are common in the field of algorithms and data structures (cs.DS). The study of MDS codes is also relevant to network information theory (cs.SI) and communication networks (cs.NI).
